page.title: 08Ada Hallam,aged 90
page.content: I came to live at Barnardiston when my father was appointed Rector of All Saints church in 1898 and my childhood was spent there.Ithen left the village,but returned in 1939,and I have seen many changes.People used to work very hard and had little money,but were very happy.The fields were smaller and all the work was done by men and horses,not the large machines we have now.Children left school at 14 to work in the fields or go into service. I often think that children today are like the "Lady of Shallot" in Tennyson's poem,but instead of looking into a mirror we look at television and everything happens behind our back!
